intro: Senecio microdon, commonly known as the dwarf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It has small, narrow leaves and is often used in rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental appeal. Senecio microdon is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping.
